typedef enum oryx_path_planning::PointTrait_t oryx_path_planning::PointTrait

Standard parameter warning message.

Author:
Adam Panzica Enum for describing the state of a point The integer enumeration value is mapped to an RGBA color space representation for ease of translating to color map as well as to allow for using the pcl::PointRBGA class to represent data

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum oryx_path_planning::PointTrait_t

Standard parameter warning message.

Author:
Adam Panzica Enum for describing the state of a point The integer enumeration value is mapped to an RGBA color space representation for ease of translating to color map as well as to allow for using the pcl::PointRBGA class to represent data
Enumerator:
OBSTACLE 

OBSTACLE Point on the grid contains an obstacle (Red)

INFLATED 

INFLATED Point on the grid is occupied by a safety inflation radius (Blue)

UNKNOWN 

UNKNOWN Point on the grid is unknown (Grey)

FREE_HIGH_COST 

FREE_HIGH_COST Point on the grid is free but is expensive to travel over (Teal)

FREE_LOW_COST 

FREE_LOW_COST Point on the grid is free but is easy to travel over (Green)

TRAVERSED 

TRAVERSED Point on the grid is free but has been previously traversed (Olive Drab)

GOAL 

GOAL Point on the grid is the goal position (Yellow)

TENTACLE 

TENTACLE Point on the grid is a Tentacle marker (Pink)

ROBOT 

ROBOT Point on the grid is the robot's center point.

Definition at line 78 of file OryxPathPlanningUtilities.h.

Function Documentation

void oryx_path_planning::castArc ( int  radius,
double  sweep_angle,
int  rgba,
Point &  origin,
PointCloud &  cloud,
int  quadrant = 1,
int  plane = 0 
) [inline]

Generates the series of points along a 90* arc between two points and places them into a PointCloud.

Author:
Adam Panzica
Parameters:
radiusThe radius of the arch to cast
sweep_angleThe angle, in radians, to sweep the arc in the given quadrant and plane
rgbaThe value to fill the rgba field of the points with
originThe origin of the arc
cloudPointCloud to write the arc into
quadrantThe quadrant that the arc lies in (1, 2, 3 or 4, anything outside that range will be 1)
planeThe plane to cast the arc in (0 for xy, 1 for xz, 2 for yz)

Definition at line 305 of file OryxPathPlanningUtilities.h.

void oryx_path_planning::castLine ( Point &  startPoint,
Point &  endPoint,
int  rgba,
PointCloud &  cloud 
) [inline]

Generates the series of points along a line between two points and places them into a PointCloud.

Author:
Adam Panzica
Parameters:
startPoint[in] The starting point of the line
endPoint[in] The ending point of the line
res[in] The resolution of the grid to place points on
rgba[in] The RGBA value to place into the points on the line
cloud[out] The PointCloud to put the generated points into

Uses a 3D implementation of Bresenham's algorithm to generate an approximation of the straight line rasterized to the given grid resolution. The RGBA values of the start point and end point are copied into the respective points in the cloud, with the points between them filled with the value given by the RGBA parameter

double  resolution 
) [inline]

Turns a given point in grid coordinates into a real value

Parameters:
gridThe point on the grid
resolutionThe resolution of the grid
Returns:
A double corresponding to a real value represented by a grid coordinate

double oryx_path_planning::roundToFrac ( double  raw,
double  frac 
) [inline]

Rounds a value to the nearest scale point. EX: raw=12.35, frac=.25, return = 12.25

Parameters:
rawRaw value to round
fracFraction to scale to
Returns:
The result of std::floor(raw/scale)*scale

Definition at line 168 of file OryxPathPlanningUtilities.h.

int oryx_path_planning::roundToGrid ( double  raw,
double  resolution 
) [inline]

Turns a real coordinate into an integer value for a grid with a given resolution.

Parameters:
rawThe raw coordinate value
resolutionThe resolution of the grid to place the point on
Returns:
The location of the point on the grid, equivalent to (int)std::floor(raw/resolution)
